description: Seems like it can understand and authenticate with the RDP server but will be stuck in a connection loop
I had freezing issues with remmina, this is smooth and better than remmina...
Finally something that feels like mstsc ;)

I used other rdp clients (to connect to a windows machine) and while they work the visual quality is not the greatest, there is a lot of compression. With this client the visuals are great, no compression artifacts and latency is good as well.

I've tried other RDP applications like Remmina but they don't implement the full stack of options from RDP as Thincast. It allows the use of all my monitors, connects to any computer with RDP, even the ones that require customization right into the .RDP file, and I can use my webcam and other USB devices. It's just a little heavier, I couldn't figure out why but the performance of the remote servers is a little slower than with the original Microsoft's Remote Desktop. 
Recommended.
I connect to Windows machine through RDP with a gateway.

Installation hangs with the message:
Automatically connect eligible plugs and slots of snap "thincast-client"

It gives a very good picture quality over RDP but it crushes every time an application is being launched on the remote machine. E.g.: Once you start Microsoft Outlook on a remote machine, Thincast client immediately crashes. Happens with any application.
So version 1.0.444 works OK if you do not launch any applications on the remote host)))
Native GNOME Remote Desktop Viewer gives excellent visual quality and does not crush, yet very buggy. But still a better choice than Thincast if good picture quality is important to you.
summary: Very Good RDP visual quality BUT crushes

description: Thought I might never find a good RDP client for Ubuntu, this one is the best
summary: Excellent, works well and very professional

description: First one that allows copy/paste files to Windows computers out of the box. Sleek looking and not too complicated for newbies.

This could be THE implementation. Everything exactly like the Windows RDP client. But most of the time the application just hangs my Ubuntu 20.04 up to 22.04. And I mean HANG. Just plain dead. In a state that you can only force Power-Off.

En télétravail depuis le confinement, j'utilisais Remmina mais avec un gros problème, le dual screen. 
Avec Thincast le RDP peut être affiché sur plusieurs écrans. Le pied !
